channel.title: Emote's (server sided)
channel.description:
Does anyone have the Clicking most cases for the 474 emote tab? I've used Harry's but I keep getting 1 error, and when I attempt to fix I get 100..
Thank you.
P.S [non-renamed]

item.title: Emote's (server sided)
item.dc:creator: @sertan8 sertan8
item.description:
@sertan8 wrote:

After the last bracket add another one.

That should work

Read full topic

item.title: Emote's (server sided)
item.dc:creator: @RealmofOmens RealmofOmens
item.description:
@RealmofOmens wrote:

[quote=“Teem_Rocket, post:10, topic:525539”]Just because you get 100 errors from adding a Bracket to that spot, that doesn’t mean it doesn’t belong there.

P.S. you don’t need to comment out lines like:

     // this
     // is
     // not
     // needed

When you can just use:

/* blah blah blah */ [/quote]

I know, the code I’m using was from a snippet. I didn’t add the // to it.

Anyway, does anyone have any other emote cases in their clickingmost.java?

Read full topic

item.title: Emote's (server sided)
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Just because you get 100 errors from adding a Bracket to that spot, that doesn’t mean it doesn’t belong there.

P.S. you don’t need to comment out lines like:

     // this
     // is
     // not
     // needed

When you can just use:

     /*
     blah blah
     blah
     */

Read full topic

item.title: Emote's (server sided)
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Learn how switch statements work and then com back
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/switch.html

Read full topic

item.title: Emote's (server sided)
item.dc:creator: @RealmofOmens RealmofOmens
item.description:
@RealmofOmens wrote:

Teem_Rocket:

Post the code you’re having trouble with instead of trying to find workarounds. It’s probably an issue with a switch statement or something. You can also just debug these yourself. You don’t need to find a list or anything.

The actual code itself, or the error? I’ve posted my code 4 posts above… lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Emote's (server sided)
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Post the code you’re having trouble with instead of trying to find workarounds. It’s probably an issue with a switch statement or something. You can also just debug these yourself. You don’t need to find a list or anything.

}

break;
